Data: South African have won the toss and chosen to chase.
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs back of a length, bit of width, 84mph/135kph and Warner carves it away through the covers off the back foot! Bit of a freebie to start, nicely timed with a cross bat

Steyn to Warner, OUT Warner goes second ball, and Steyn is pumped! Length ball, plenty of bounce, found the top edge as he looked to flick it into the leg side, and it flew up to Shamsi at long leg on the boundary. Steyn brings out a slow-motion chainsaw celebration, and Warner looks disgruntled at the extent to which that shot up from a length
Steyn to Finch, FOUR runs bludgeoned through the covers for four!
Steyn to Finch, 1 run length outside off, looks to guide it through the off side and inside edges down to long leg
Steyn to Smith, no run wide length ball outside the off stump, fenced out to cover on the edge of the ring
Steyn to Smith, no run slower ball, slightly full of a length. Holds in the pitch, Smith pushes into the off side
Ngidi to Finch, FOUR runs width outside the off stump, sits up, and Finch flays it through cover point for four! Imperious
Ngidi to Finch, no run short ball, looks to tuck it into the leg side but it strikes the body and dribbles down at his feet
Ngidi to Finch, 3 runs length outside off, punched through the covers off the back foot. Du Plessis races after it, and brings out a big dive to cut it off
Ngidi to Smith, no run length outside off, 86mph/139kph, Smith shuffles across looking to hoick from outside off and through midwicket, but can't lay bat on it
Ngidi to Smith, no run back of a length outside off, looks to crunch through the covers off the back foot but is through the shot early. Skews into the off side off the bat

Ngidi to Smith, FOUR runs short and wide outside the off stump, cut uppishly down to Steyn on the third-man boundary, but he loses sight of it right at the last moment and it flies over his right shoulder! Looks like he lost it in the floodlights, didn't make any attempt to catch it!
Steyn to Finch, no run slower ball, Finch looks to flick through square leg but is struck on the thigh pad. Down at 69mph/110kph
Steyn to Finch, no run length ball in the channel, fended out to cover on the back foot

Steyn to Finch, 1 run dipping slower ball, turns into a low full toss, and clipped out to midwicket. This was the very slow slower ball, down at 74mph, which he foxed Bairstow with in the England series. Hard to pick out the hand
Steyn to Smith, FOUR runs full and wide, Smith throws everything at it and slashes it through backward point for four!
Steyn to Smith, 1 run driven out to mid-off for one
Steyn to Finch, FOUR runs length, wide outside off, opens the face and flays it through point for four! Crunched, great shot
Rabada to Smith, SIX runs back-of-a-length outside off, Smith throws plenty at this looking to slug over midwicket, top-edged it over third man for six! That's what altitude will do...
Rabada to Smith, 1 run steered down to third man
Rabada to Finch, FOUR runs steep bounce, Finch is cramped for room but jabs his bat at it and guides it down to third man for a one-bounce four! Shaping to cut, done for pace but enough on it
Rabada to Finch, no run length on off stump, driven to Smuts at cover. 91mph/147kph
Rabada to Finch, no run length on leg stump, tickled round the corner to Shamsi on the 45
Rabada to Finch, no run 92mph/147kph yorker on off stump, dug out to straight midiwkcet
Ngidi to Smith, 1 run back of a length, tucked out to square leg off the hip
Ngidi to Finch, no run back of a length, steps outside leg and drives out to extra cover on the back foot. Hurls down the stumps at the non-striker's, but Smith is comfortably in
Ngidi to Finch, FOUR runs back of a length, pulled very hard in front of square and away for four! Powerful shot, sat back in his crease and nailed it in front of the man out on the fence
Ngidi to Finch, FOUR runs slower ball outside off, waits back in his crease and nails it over extra cover! Too short, Finch flings his bat at it and middles it for a one-bounce four
Ngidi to Finch, 2 runs length, opens the face and steers down to wide third man for a couple. 88mph/142kph
Ngidi to Finch, SIX runs full and straight, Finch lofts straight down the ground for six! Straight bat, opened up to get leg side of the ball, and launched over mid-off for an 82m maximum

Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs wide outside the off stump, throws his hands at it, and it races away through backward point for four. Smith had so much time, transferred his weight onto the back foot and it sat up nicely off the pitch
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run worked out to short midwicket, can't beat the fielder
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run shuffles across to the off side, looks to guide it through point but inside edges towards midwicket
Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs fullish outside off, Smith throws plenty at it looking to go through extra cover but inside edges past leg stump and away for four!

Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run beaten all ends up! Not quite sure how that missed... came back into the right-hander, and cut him in half, jagging between the bat and the back leg, bouncing just over the top!
Phehlukwayo to Smith, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, adjusts his weight and flays this through point for four! Absolutely thumped, not a great ball and Smith nails it over the man in the ring
Shamsi to Finch, 1 run full to start, whipped out to square leg, de Kock races after it to stop the second
Shamsi to Smith, 1 wide legbreak, flatter, but down the leg side
Shamsi to Smith, 1 wide down the leg side again, Shamsi under the pump. Short boundary is on the off side, hence this line
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run tossed up on off stump, clipped out to deep midwicket
Shamsi to Finch, 1 wide speared down the leg side again, Shamsi in a spot of bother
Shamsi to Finch, no run cramps him for room, struck on the pad looking to work through midwicket
Shamsi to Finch, 1 run full on leg stump, tucked out behind square
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run tossed up, full on fifth stump, slugged out to deep midwicket
Shamsi to Finch, 1 run tucked out to square leg on the back foot
Phehlukwayo to Finch, 1 wide short and wide, and he'll have to bowl it again. Sloppy stuff from SA
Phehlukwayo to Finch, 1 run slower ball, nudged out to mid-off
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run short ball, pulled hard and Smuts makes a great diving stop at deep backward square to save three runs
Phehlukwayo to Finch, no run steered out to cover point, can't beat the fielder
Phehlukwayo to Finch, no run length outside off, looks to carve through cover but can't lay bat on it. Finch looks filthy with himself
Phehlukwayo to Finch, 1 run length on off stump, steered down to wide third man
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run length outside off, Smith shuffles across and pulls out to deep midwicket, but can only find the fielder on the bounce
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run fairly flat, slightly full of a length outside off, steered towards cover point

Shamsi to Finch, OUT Finch steps outside leg, Shamsi follows him, he throws everything through the shot regardless but can't time it. Faf du Plessis settles underneath it at deep midwicket, and takes a good catch on the rope! Just about stayed inside the rope, and that breaks a very useful partnership
Shamsi to Smith, 1 wide down the leg side, another wide
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run pushed out for a single
Shamsi to Wade, 2 runs legbreak, good turn, carved out to deep cover off the back foot
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run nudged out to third man via the outside half of the bat for a single
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run tossed up outside off, bit of turn as Smith looks to drive through cover, and he inside edges through his legs and away towards backwards square
Smuts to Smith, 1 run pushed out to mid-off for a jogged single

Smuts to Wade, FOUR runs launched high, high, very high into the night sky towards deep midwicket... and dropped by van Biljon the debutant! Not the easiest chance, and there was some miscommunication with Rabada... Wade slog-swept, top-edged, and gets a life
Smuts to Wade, 1 run leading edge into the off side, lands safely
Smuts to Smith, 2 runs whipped out to deep midwicket, and they hare back for a second
Smuts to Smith, 1 run short and wide, steered out to cover on the edge of the ring and they race through
Smuts to Wade, no run length on off stump, worked back to the bowler. Ricochets off Smith towards long-off, Wade thinks about stealing a run but Smith sends him back

Shamsi to Smith, 1 wide, OUT length ball, down the leg side again and Smith uses his feet looking to work through midwicket... he can't lay bat on it, and de Kock whips the bails off! Think Shamsi saw him coming, dragged it down the leg side, and that's a very sharp stumping made to look easy by QdK. Huge moment!
Shamsi to Carey, 1 run full outside off, Carey gets down to sweep out to deep backward square
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run length ball, cramps him up, chipped out to midwicket
Shamsi to Carey, no run slightly full outside off, looks to cut but it keeps a touch low and hits the bottom of the bat
Shamsi to Carey, no run beaten outside off, de Kock whips the bails off but Carey didn't lift his back foot
Shamsi to Carey, SIX runs slog sweeps out to deep midwicket, van der Dussen is in the game on the rope... but can only tip it over the bar! At full stretch, leaping, but can only get fingertips on it

Shamsi to Carey, no run length ball, sharp bounce, and edged behind! No, Paleker doesn't like it! SA review almost immediately. Rocked back looking to cut ... nothing on UltraEdge! Great decision, SA were convinced but they must have been deceived by another noise. Carey survives.
Smuts to Marsh, 1 run opens up, carving out to deep cover
Smuts to Carey, 2 runs speared in halfway down, clipped out to midwicket and they scamper back for a couple
Smuts to Carey, no run full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
Smuts to Carey, 1 run length ball, slightly cramped for room as he pulls out to deep midwicket
Smuts to Marsh, 1 run speared in halfway down, cut out to Steyn in the covers
Smuts to Carey, 1 run length outside off, clubbed to deep midwicket
Rabada to Carey, 1 wide hung wide outside the off stump, and called wide
Rabada to Carey, no run length ball, sharp bounce, cut to Phehlukwayo at cover point
Rabada to Carey, FOUR runs length ball, flashes hard, past backward point and in front of wide third man to run away for four! Offcutter, enough width to cut, and nicely played off the back foot
Rabada to Carey, FOUR runs length ball pushed across him at 88mph/142kph, square-cut brilliantly away to the boundary! Played very late, beats backward point and races to the fence
Rabada to Carey, 1 wide length outside off, harshly called wide. Looked inside the tramlines to me
Rabada to Carey, 1 run slashes at a slower ball, running it down to third man

Rabada to Marsh, FOUR runs back of a length ball, Marsh top-edges over the keeper for a one-bounce four! 88mph/142kph, looked to slug over square leg but was through it early, and bounces just inside the rope
Rabada to Marsh, 1 run tucked out to long leg off the hip
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run slower ball, rocks onto the back foot and cross-bats it down to long-on

Phehlukwayo to Carey, FOUR runs looks to clip through the leg side, finds the outside edge, past de Kock's left hand and away for four! Deceived Carey, little cutter which he didn't pick, and Australia get another slice of luck
Phehlukwayo to Carey, no run thumped to mid-off, Steyn makes an excellent diving stop
Phehlukwayo to Carey, 1 run steers a back-of-a-length ball down to third man
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run slower ball, hangs back to nudge into the covers
Phehlukwayo to Carey, 1 run cutter again, follows Carey as the batsman looks to give himself room and he can only nudge into the covers
Steyn to Carey, 1 run wide on the crease, cutter, slashed out to deep backward point
Steyn to Marsh, no run length outside off, looks to thump through cover off the back foot and can't lay bat on it
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run slower ball, yorker-length on fourth stump, dug out to long-on. That's the dipping one out of the fingertips, down at 65mph/104kph
Steyn to Carey, no run wide on the crease, quicker ball on a length, and beats Carey. 87mph/140kph this time, and does Carey for pace
Steyn to Carey, 2 leg byes shifts across to the off side looking to scoop, Steyn follows him and it skews off Carey's body down towards de Kock. Slight fumble, couple of leg byes
Steyn to Carey, no run pulled out to square leg, dot to finish
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run cutter, Marsh is through the shot early looking to dump one over midwicket
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 wide wide yorker outside off, left alone and called wide. Phehlukwayo grimaces towards the umpire, but it looked like a fair call
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, SIX runs length outside off, Marsh picks this one up early and hammers it over cow corner! 82 metres, clubbed hard out the meat of the bat
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run length outside off, carved out to deep cover

Phehlukwayo to Carey, OUT full on off stump, Carey throws everything at it but it flies straight up into the air... Faf sets himself at backward point, it comes down with snow on it but he takes an excellent catch before falling onto his back! Relief, after what seemed like an eternity under the high ball
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run wide of the off stump, carved out to the boundary-rider
Phehlukwayo to Agar, 1 run punched out to deep cover to get off the mark
Shamsi to Smith, no run tossed up, full and straight, worked back to Shamsi
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run Smith uses his feet, googly from Shamsi, short enough to work out to midwicket without any real problem
Shamsi to Wade, 3 runs tossed up, wide outside the off stump. Wade throws his hands at it, and it flies aerially out towards backwards point. Rabada cuts it off, but they'll get back for a third
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run length ball, fired in flatter, tucked out to Miller grazing at cow corner
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run swept to short fine leg from outside off, they race through for a single
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run chipped straight down the ground, misfield from van der Dussen running in from long-off, but they don't take on the second run
Steyn to Smith, 1 run bit of width outside off, driven to extra cover where Phehlukwayo makes a superb stop low to his left. Saves three runs
Steyn to Wade, 1 wide shuffles over to the off side, and Steyn looks to fire one in at the ribs. Called wide, harshly I'd suggest. Good bounce and carry
Steyn to Wade, no run uses his feet, doesn't pick the 73mph/118kph slower ball, and checks his shot at the last, pushing into the covers
Steyn to Wade, FOUR runs short and wide, crunched through point for four! Not a good ball, and Wade times the cut shot sweetly
Steyn to Wade, 2 runs shuffles across to the off stump, pulls firmly off the hip out to long leg for a couple

Steyn to Wade, OUT slower ball, length outside off, huge blow high into the air, but it's not got the distance on it to clear the long side of the ground... Miller settles underneath it at deep midwicket, and takes the catch! De Kock's aggressive move does the trick as Steyn strikes
Steyn to Smith, 1 wide slower ball, wayward down the leg side and he'll have to try again
Steyn to Smith, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut aerially down to deep backward point on the bounce
Ngidi to Agar, no run slowie in the channel, Agar looks to drive through the covers but can't lay bat on it
Ngidi to Agar, 1 run another cutter, fenced out to cover point to get big Mitch on strike
Ngidi to Marsh, 1 wide full toss, down the leg side

Ngidi to Marsh, OUT length outside off, clubbed very high into the leg side, and Steyn takes a brilliant catch! Looks to mow one over midwicket, top-edged it towards square leg, where Steyn ran in and round, before diving to take the chance... EDIT: only just clung on, landed in the fingertips and very nearly popped out!
Ngidi to Agar, 1 run nudged out to point, de Kock does the fielding and Agar turns down the second
Ngidi to Starc, no run slower ball, not picked and Starc is through the shot too early... beaten all ends up!

Ngidi to Starc, SIX runs length outside off, clubbed miles into the air, and it carries this time! Starc throws plenty into the shot, it went high into the air and just about beat du Plessis at long-on... just the 74 metres
Rabada to Agar, FOUR runs fullish outside off, slashed between extra cover and mid-off and away for four! Cleared the front dog, and carved into the gap
Rabada to Agar, SIX runs all the way this time! In the slot, Agar sits deep in the crease and slugs it just over mid-off

Rabada to Agar, 2 runs edged to short third man, where Shamsi takes an easy chance pulls out of it! Bizarre, miscommunication between de Kock and Shamsi, and neither of them went for what would have been an easy chance
Rabada to Agar, 1 run yorker, dug out into the off side
Rabada to Starc, 1 run back of a length, follows him, bottom-edged towards short midwicket and they scamper through for one

Rabada to Agar, FOUR runs back of a length, looks to mow through midwicket but top-edged down to third man for four! Australia have had plenty of luck this innings, and that's how it ends, with a bit of fortune.

7.37pm: 196 for 6 - nowhere near as many as it might have been from a platform of 70 for 1 after the first six, but a useful total nonetheless. Finch and Smith got Australia off to a fast start, before Marsh, Carey and Agar's cameos dragged them up to a pretty useful score, that I would guess is slightly above par. South Africa were profligate, giving away 12 wides, and some of the fielding
"196 off 22 overs" chimes Roger Walker. How costly will those wides prove?
Alan Gardner will be here in 10 minutes or so to take you through the run chase.
"How many times in t20s has every batsman hit a 4 or 6 but no one make a 50?" Probably more often than you think, Henry (aka. I have no idea)

Hello, everyone. That was a reasonably satisfying thrash from Australia - a little disjointed but they got up to a pretty decent score. Can South Africa produce some unrelenting pongo of their own, or is it going to be three T20I defeats on the spin?
Here come the Australians, who it's worth noting haven't lost in this format since 2018. Mitchell Starc to start up from the Corlett Drive End, one slip in
Starc to de Kock, 2 runs shortish outside off, 136kph/84mph and offering de Kock a little width as he chops through backward point, well stopped on the rope by the diving Mitchell Marsh
Starc to de Kock, no run hard length, 136kph in the channel, punched square this time
Starc to du Plessis, no run swing again, struck on the back pad... umpire Holdsworth not taken with the appeal, though! Maybe a touch high? Starc already a menace here
Starc to du Plessis, 1 run pitched up wide of off stump from over the wicket, 147kph/91mph and squeezed down towards third man to get off the mark
Starc to van der Dussen, no run full and curling back malevolently to hit the pads again... but doing too much this time
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 2 runs fired in straight with the arm, Faf works a couple through backward square leg
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run length on off stump, 134kph/83mph and du Plessis stabs it down towards backward point
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run steps down and tries to hit him off his line, skewed into the leg side for one
Kane Richardson to van der Dussen, no run good length, around off stump and van der Dussen pushes it towards mid-off
Kane Richardson to van der Dussen, no run back of a length, 137kph/85mph and zipping through past the top edge as RVD? throws the hands and misses with a cut
Kane Richardson to van der Dussen, 1 run fired in straighter, nudged behind square on the leg side
Starc to van der Dussen, no run Starc fires this full in the channel outside off, left alone by Rassie
Starc to van der Dussen, no run short of a length, banged in at 135kph/83mph and tapped down defensively from the crease
Starc to van der Dussen, 1 run bit of width, 142kph/88mph and carved down to third man off a thick outside edge
Starc to du Plessis, 1 wide pitched full, 144kph/89mph and angling across, too far across for the umpire's liking
Starc to du Plessis, no run back of a length outside off and whistling through as du Plessis attempts to ride the bounce
Starc to du Plessis, FOUR runs short on the pads, 143kph and he uses the pace to his advantage, smuggled down to fine leg for four! First boundary for du Plessis
Cummins to van der Dussen, no run back of a length, 139kph/87mph and kicking to hit high up the bat as RVD? defends on off stump

Cummins to van der Dussen, OUT slapped straight up, h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h towards third man... and taken by Starc! He had to plunge forward as the ball threatened to land short of him, but held it well, a spiralling chance into the Joburg night sky as RVD? flung the hands at a miscued drive. Cummins strikes second ball
Cummins to du Plessis, no run shortish, nipping back to take the inside edge and then kiss du Plessis on the inside thigh... Kiss like a rottweiler, that is
Cummins to du Plessis, no run back of a length, jabbed down into the covers as he starts to back away
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs brings out the scoop, gets it away to fine leg! Cute from Faf, moving across early and shovelling four
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs goes again, beyond the reach of Carey! Took this from well outside off, used the pace and got enough on it to pick up four more to fine leg
Kane Richardson to Smuts, FOUR runs short and smoked through midwicket! Smuts latches on to his first ball and muscles it away
Kane Richardson to Smuts, 1 run back of a length outside off, punched through the covers
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, no run shortish, maybe a cutter, just 118kph and du Plessis swings wildly only for it to come off the toe of the bat
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run pitched up in the channel, thumped to the man at extra cover but a misfield brings them one
Kane Richardson to Smuts, 1 run shortish, 137kph/85mph and steered through the covers off the back foot
Kane Richardson to du Plessis, 1 run another slower ball wide of the stumps, du Plessis slaps it through the infield for one more
Cummins to du Plessis, 2 runs back of a length, 139kph/87mph and sliced past Carey off the toe, Starc does really well running around at third man to cut it off
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run short, pace off from Cummins, tucked through square leg off the back foot
Cummins to Smuts, 1 run tip and run to mid-off, Warner swoops and this could be tight... but he misses, when a direct hit would have left Smuts well short!
Cummins to du Plessis, 1 run short ball, whirled on the pull towards short fine leg, Zampa cuts it off

Cummins to Smuts, OUT top-edged on the pull, this is going to be a tough one... but Zamps holds it running back! The ball stayed up for an age, after Smuts failed to get hold of it, and Zampa must have been running around in circles from short fine leg, as he suddenly shot into view and grabbed on, before falling back and slamming his head into the turf. But he seems okay, and SA are
Cummins to du Plessis, no run stabbed into the covers, but well cut off
Zampa to Miller, 2 runs pushed through from over the wicket, turned with the spin for a couple
Zampa to van Biljon, no run tossed up, spinning on off stump and tapped away
Zampa to van Biljon, 1 run pushed through flatter, steered for a single into the covers
Zampa to du Plessis, no run another slider, angled in on off stump, Faf punches it away
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run lobbed up straighter, tucked off the front pad for a single to midwicket
Agar to du Plessis, 1 run pushed through from round the wicket, tapped through the covers
Agar to van Biljon, no run tossed up and punched towards cover
Agar to van Biljon, 1 run flatter, skidding on with the arm, nudged off the pads behind square
Zampa to van Biljon, 1 run flighted, on the stumps and worked around the corner
Zampa to Rabada, no run tossed up and Rabada defends on off stump
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run full on the stumps, Rabada tucks one through midwicket to get off the mark
Zampa to van Biljon, 1 run pushed through straighter and van Biljon works it through backward square leg
Zampa to Rabada, no run tossed up and pushed into the covers
Zampa to Rabada, no run flighted, spinning a touch on off stump, KG defends
Agar to van Biljon, FOUR runs goes for the lofted drive... and only just clears mid-off! Van Biljon biffs it just well enough to pick up four
Agar to van Biljon, no run drops back and steers towards backward point, Rabada had come down but is sent back
Agar to van Biljon, no run tossed up, spins to hit PvB on the body as he sweeps... was that high? Agar isn't keen on a review, but it looked pretty close to me!
Agar to van Biljon, 1 run tapped into a gap coming across
Agar to Rabada, SIX runs whumped into the empty stands at deep midwicket! Cleanly struck slog-sweep from KG, gives the crowd something to cheer
Agar to Rabada, 1 run pushed square on the off side, might have been two there but the calling wasn't great
Starc to Rabada, no run low full toss, Rabada hangs back and gets an inside edge on to his pads
Starc to Rabada, no run full again, bunted back down the track
Starc to Rabada, 1 wide slides a length ball down the leg side for a wide
Starc to Rabada, FOUR runs pitched up, 142kph/88mph and sweetly clipped for four! Bisects mid-on and midwicket and rattles away to the rope
Starc to Rabada, no run short ball, 143kph outside off, swing and a miss this time
Starc to Rabada, 5 wide flung down the leg side, Carey misses it as the ball bobbles in front of him... and fine leg won't get around, either! More donations to the poor
Starc to Rabada, no run good length, 144kph/89mph and straightening with malice aforethought as Rabada fishes at a drive and fails to connect
Starc to Rabada, no run pitched up, wide-ish and yorker-ish and it squeezes under the toe of the bat through to Carey
Agar to van Biljon, 2 runs tossed up on the stumps and worked through the leg side
Agar to van Biljon, no run flatter, on the stumps and not much turn, van Biljon covers up in defence
Agar to van Biljon, FOUR runs edged wide of the tumbling Finch! Turn and bounce for Agar and van Biljon fences wildly at it, just out of reach at slip, might have even grazed the fingertips!
Agar to van Biljon, 1 run pushed through on the stumps and nudged behind square on the leg side
Agar to Rabada, 1 run fired across the bows from round the wicket, Rabada slaps a cut to deep backward point
Kane Richardson to Rabada, 1 run shortish outside off and Rabada slices one to third man
Kane Richardson to Ngidi, no run pitched up, Ngidi gets into line and jabs it towards mid-on
Kane Richardson to Ngidi, no run back of a length, in the channel and he fails to connect
Kane Richardson to Ngidi, no run short outside off, 136kph/84mph and again Ngidi swings hard but fails to connect
Kane Richardson to Ngidi, 1 run makes a bit of room and slaps it back down the track, Richardson gets a hand on it
Kane Richardson to Rabada, SIX runs banged in short, Rabada pulls - hoicked high into the crowd at fine leg! Rabada continuing to belt a few consolation runs for the SA cause
Agar to Shamsi, no run so close to hitting off stump! Spinning through as Shamsi tried to cut and missed, nearly Agar's second 'trick of the game!
Agar to Shamsi, 1 run drops back and cuts, gets it through for a scrambled single
Agar to Rabada, no run tossed up and tapped back
Agar to Rabada, 1 run steps down and swings one more away through midwicket
Agar to Shamsi, no run floated up wide of the stumps, Shamsi comes across and pokes it away safely... Agar finishes with 5 for 25, and that has pretty much finished South Africa
Zampa to Rabada, 1 run tossed up and worked off the stumps
Zampa to Shamsi, 1 run flicked for a single
Australia won by 107 runs
Player of the match is Ashton Agar, AUS
